name: What a Wonderful World Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: Eva was so helpful and sweet, and her special breakfasts were not to miss. Great accommodations close to beach and the great coastal path in Wailea. Really enjoyed my stay here in Garden Suite - lots of room and beautiful fountain outside the door that lulled me into relaxation. Great homey amenities as well and big kitchen if you need to cook. Beach supplies helpful, too. You could be as social as you wanted or as private as you wanted.
reviews.title: Clean accommodations, close to where you want to be, great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a treat! Breakfast with "chef" Eva is to die for!!
reviews.title: Great Host on a Great Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this location for your Maui vacation. It is a little far from most tourist attractions, but the parking is onsite and free. Eva gave us excellent recommendations for activities so we felt like we got the most from our week on the island. The B&B is a few blocks from a nice beach but walkable and she has many beach toys for your use--try the boogieboards! There are many restaurants to choose from and even a grocery store not too far away. She gave us a grand tour and we were able to help ourselves to all the things we would need. I do wish that there had a been a foot bath at the front door becuase after a day at the beach, the sand coming into the suite could not be avoided. I would have enjoyed a mid week cleaning just to reduce some of the sand collection!
reviews.title: Maui was beautiful and the hostess was fantastic.

reviews.text: Fabulous bed and breakfast! Eva was wonderful and really made me feel like I was at home! She was really accommodating and helpful in helping me get around the island. Breakfasts were great too!
reviews.title: Felt like home away from home!!

reviews.text: I really appreciate to stay there. The location is very nice, and the people there are great. Very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful the wonderful world B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an eay place to find. Eva provides great directions and the GPS works too.
reviews.title: Peaceful with Wonderful Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in a quiet neighbourhood, you will awake to the sounds of birds in the morning. With great views to Haleakala and the West Maui Forest Reserve from the breakfast area, this is a great place to start any day.
reviews.title: Very relaxed stay - very helpful and friendly service
We are always coming back, just perfect...
reviews.text: Eva knows the area well and is willing to share her insights on stuff to do and places to go. Breakfast was very good with plenty to eat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upper floor rooms would be best if you are looking for the best view and a bit more peace and quiet.
reviews.title: Wonderful World made for a wonderful trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice & quiet location. Eva knows how to make her guests feel like home. Very rich and tasty breakfasts! Our room made us feel like staying in a jungle. (But be aware of the noisy refrigerator - we switches it off at night for better sleep.)
reviews.title: Truly wonderful B&B with lovely hostess and beautiful view in the morning eating breakfast

reviews.text: The large breakfast deck with its magical ocean and hill views is so magnifying that I had to remind myself of my itinerary for the day and pull myself away from the ambiance and friendliness of the hosts ,who are so helpful and generous.this friendliness and helpfulness is contagious and it does not take long for everyone staying at this b&b to feel at home and comfortable with each other.The rooms are private and clean and the location is central with easy access to the fwy or beach and an easy stroll to the local bus transport.
reviews.title: what a wonderfull stay.welcoming ,helpful and full of aloha

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed it so much that I extended my stay of 4 days at this b&b with an extra 7 days.what a great time I had
reviews.title: Maui's Hospitality at it's Finest

reviews.text: We are so pleased to have stayed at Eva's fabulous B&B during our last honeymoon days in Maui. Being married in Maui was the best day of our lives and having stayed at this amazing B&B on our vacation is a memory we will never forget. The hospitality was exceptional and we enjoyed all the delicious breakfasts prepared by Eva- she's a riot to sit and talk with and is truly a genuine individual. Just an amazing time!!!!
reviews.title: It truly is a Wonderful Bed & Breakfast

reviews.text: My daughter's and my stay was made most pleasant by the hospitality of Eva. She went out of her way to make our stay was memorable. She advised us on restaurants, a driver and places of interest. The room was clean, big and had everything available to you for cooking if you chose to do so. The courtyard was beautiful and the Lenai had breathtaking views. The 15 minute walk to the beach was easy and you had towels, umbrellas, chairs and water toys at you disposal.Also available was a washer and dryer which was great. The breakfasts were amazing ( never had to have lunch). I have no complaints only wonderful memories!
reviews.title: Truly a wonderful world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a pleasant stay it was. Eva is very accommodating and made certain we felt at home away from home. The location is not direct at the beach but one can see the ocean from the upper terrace where breakfast is served or just chill during the day with some coffee. A great open air terrace with great looking bamboo furniture. The room was clean and large with a small kitchenette.
reviews.title: What a wonderful piece of Maui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel a lot and I have never had an experience like this. Eva is so helpful and made our trip so much better. She tells you great places to see and gets you there with no problem. Her breakfasts are to die for. If you want the true taste of Hawaii ask for her crunchy french toast and the fruit is so fresh. You can tell she truly loves her job and takes pride in what she offers. The beds are the best. So comfortable and the linens are soft and luxurious. TOTALLY WORTH IT!
reviews.title: THE BEST PLACE I'VE EVER STAYED!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a friendly atmosphere in a lush setting with gorgeous ocean views, and delicious morning breakfast, this is the B&B for you. Only a 2-minute drive to the beaches in Kihei, we were warmly welcomed during our mid-August 10-day stay. Our room was equipped with a small refrigerator and large LCD TV. There are DVD movies and books to choose from. Also, if you are in need of a cooler, surf equipment, or a blanket for cooler climes at 10,000 feet, Eva will see to your needs. Don't hesitate to ask questions, as Eva, a seasoned and savvy world traveler, will time and time again enlighten you.
reviews.title: Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were a little weary about staying in a B&B, but we were so happy with our stay at What a Wonderful World B&B. The rooms have everything you need and Eva provides you with everything you need for the beach too. There's boogie boards, beach towels, beach umbrellas, snorkel gear, and more. Breakfast was amazing, pancakes, waffles, eggs benedict, the best mangos I've every eaten, and many other fresh fruits. And Eva and Jim were so accommodating and helpful. They really know the island. Eva put us on a great snorkelling trip to Molokini, told us what to see in Hana (the bamboo forest is quite the site), and Jim recommended some great snorkelling spots on the west shore (Honolua is my favourite).
reviews.title: A Wonderful World Indeed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One aspect of this B&B we really enjoyed was the view from the Lanai. We absolutely loved it. the sunsets were incredible so, we made sure we ate dinner up there a few times during our stay. Some of the other guests didn't seem to take advantage of this beautiful view, eating their dinners out or on the patio on the lower level shaded by the trees. Make sure you have at least one dinner on the Lanai.
reviews.title: best b+b in Hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this place will surely come back someday.
reviews.title: Just what I hoped for!

aka: What a Wonderful World Hotel Kihei
description: Bed and Breakfast recommended by Frommer's, Lonely Planet, Paradise Family guides and many more, complete with all the amenities, including snorkel gear and beach equipment, BBQ grill, large DVD collection, cable TV and free internet, free laundry facilities, phone, and off street parking. Our goal is to provide guests with a Maui Home where we help create lasting memories over provided accommodations.
